00074 enum {

00100 void EnsureIdentifiersInitialized() {
00101   printf("void EnsureIdentifiersInitialized() {\n");
00102   static bool identifiers_initialized = false;
00103   if (identifiers_initialized)
00104     return;
00105   
00106   browser->getstringidentifiers(plugin_property_identifier_names,
00107                                 NUM_PROPERTY_IDENTIFIERS,
00108                                 plugin_property_identifiers);
00109   browser->getstringidentifiers(plugin_method_identifier_names,
00110                                 NUM_METHOD_IDENTIFIERS,
00111                                 plugin_method_identifiers);
00112   identifiers_initialized = true;
00113 }

00117 std::string CreateStringFromNPVariant(const NPVariant& variant) {
00118   printf("std::string CreateStringFromNPVariant(const NPVariant& variant) {\n");
00119   return std::string(NPVARIANT_TO_STRING(variant).UTF8Characters,
00120                      NPVARIANT_TO_STRING(variant).UTF8Length);
00121 }

00125 static bool StoreHex(const _NPVariant key, const _NPVariant val) {
00126   printf("static bool StoreHex(const _NPVariant key, const _NPVariant val) {      \n");
00127   std::string s_key = CreateStringFromNPVariant(key);
00128   std::string s_val = CreateStringFromNPVariant(val);
00129 
00130   printf("----------------------------------\n");
00131   printf("key: %s\n", s_key.c_str());
00132   printf("len(val) == %d\n", s_val.size());
00133                                         
00134   // store a hex encoded value.
00135   HEX_STORE.Store(s_key, s_val);
00136   if (!HEX_STORE.Ok())
00137     printf("HEXSTORE ERROR: %d\n", HEX_STORE.Err());
00138   return true;
00139 }
00140 
00141 static bool AppendHex(const _NPVariant key, const _NPVariant val) {
00142   printf("static bool AppendHex(const _NPVariant key, const _NPVariant val) {\n");
00143   std::string s_key = CreateStringFromNPVariant(key);
00144   std::string s_val = CreateStringFromNPVariant(val);      
00145 
00146   printf("Appending Store ----------------------------------\n");
00147   printf("key: %s\n", s_key.c_str());
00148 
00149   HEX_STORE.Append(s_key, s_val);
00150 
00151   if (HEX_STORE.Ok()){
00152     printf("len(val) == %d\n", HEX_STORE.ValLength(s_key));
00153     printf("decoding: %s\n", HEX_STORE.ByteArray(s_key));
00154   } else {
00155     HEX_STORE.ReportErr();
00156   } 
00157   return true;
00158 }

00161 static bool FortyTwo(const _NPVariant result) {
00162   printf("static bool FortyTwo(const _NPVariant result) {\n");
00163   std::string s = CreateStringFromNPVariant(result);
00164   s += "\n";
00165   printf(s.c_str());
00166   return true;
00167 }

00169 // This function creates a string in the browser's memory pool and then returns
00170 // a variable containing a pointer to that string.  The variable is later
00171 // returned back to the browser by the Invoke() function that called this.
00172 static bool HelloWorld(NPVariant *result) {
00173   printf("static bool HelloWorld(NPVariant *result) {\n");
00174   if (result) {
00175     const char *msg = "hello, world. soon to be img.";
00176     const int msg_length = strlen(msg) + 1;
00177     // Note: |msg_copy| will be freed later on by the browser, so it needs to
00178     // be allocated here with NPN_MemAlloc().
00179     char *msg_copy = reinterpret_cast<char*>(NPN_MemAlloc(msg_length));
00180     strncpy(msg_copy, msg, msg_length);
00181     STRINGN_TO_NPVARIANT(msg_copy, msg_length - 1, *result);
00182   }
00183   return true;
00184 }

00186 // Helper functions ------------------------------------------------------------
00187 
00188 bool TestGetProperty(PluginObject* obj,
00189                      const NPVariant* args, uint32_t arg_count,
00190                      NPVariant* result) {
00191   printf("bool TestGetProperty(PluginObject* obj,\n");
00192   if (arg_count == 0)
00193     return false;
00194 
00195   NPObject *object;
00196   browser->getvalue(obj->npp(), NPNVWindowNPObject, &object);
00197 
00198   for (uint32_t i = 0; i < arg_count; i++) {
00199     assert(NPVARIANT_IS_STRING(args[i]));
00200     std::string property_string = CreateStringFromNPVariant(args[i]);
00201     NPIdentifier property_identifier =
00202         browser->getstringidentifier(property_string.c_str());
00203 
00204     NPVariant variant;
00205     bool retval = browser->getproperty(obj->npp(), object, property_identifier,
00206                                        &variant);
00207     browser->releaseobject(object);
00208 
00209     if (!retval)
00210       break;
00211 
00212     if (i + 1 < arg_count) {
00213       assert(NPVARIANT_IS_OBJECT(variant));
00214       object = NPVARIANT_TO_OBJECT(variant);
00215     } else {
00216       *result = variant;
00217       return true;
00218     }
00219   }
00220 
00221   VOID_TO_NPVARIANT(*result);
00222   return false;
00223 }

00228   printf("NPObject* PluginAllocate(NPP npp, NPClass* the_class) {\n");
00229   EnsureIdentifiersInitialized();
00230   PluginObject* newInstance = new PluginObject(npp);
00231   return reinterpret_cast<NPObject*>(newInstance);
00232 }

00244 bool PluginHasMethod(NPObject* obj, NPIdentifier name) {
00245   printf("bool PluginHasMethod(NPObject* obj, NPIdentifier name) {\n");
00246   for (int i = 0; i < NUM_METHOD_IDENTIFIERS; i++) {
00247     if (name == plugin_method_identifiers[i])
00248       return true;
00249   }
00250   return false;
00251 }
00252 
00253 bool PluginInvoke(NPObject* header,
00254                   NPIdentifier name,
00255                   const NPVariant* args, uint32_t arg_count,
00256                   NPVariant* result) {
00257   printf("bool PluginInvoke(NPObject* header,\n");
00258   PluginObject* plugin = reinterpret_cast<PluginObject*>(header);
00259                 
00260   if (name == plugin_method_identifiers[ID_TEST_GET_PROPERTY]) {
00261     return TestGetProperty(plugin, args, arg_count, result);                    
00262   } else if (name == plugin_method_identifiers[ID_SET_TEXT_BOX]) {
00263     if (1 == arg_count && NPVARIANT_IS_OBJECT(args[0])) {
00264       //return event_handler->set_text_box(NPVARIANT_TO_OBJECT(args[0]));
00265     }
00266 
00267   } else if (name == plugin_method_identifiers[ID_MODULE_READY]) {
00268     INT32_TO_NPVARIANT(1, *result);
00269     return true;
00270                         
00271   } else if (name == plugin_method_identifiers[ID_REPORT_CHECKSUM]) {
00272     //return event_handler->addText(plugin->ReportChecksum().c_str());
00273                         
00274   } else if (name == plugin_method_identifiers[ID_IS_CHECKSUM_CHECK_SUCCESS]) {
00275     BOOLEAN_TO_NPVARIANT(plugin->IsChecksumCheckSuccess(), *result);
00276     return true;
00277 
00278   } else if (name == plugin_method_identifiers[ID_IS_HELLOWORLD]) {
00279     return HelloWorld(result);
00280                         
00281   } else if (name == plugin_method_identifiers[ID_IS_FORTYTWO]) {
00282     return FortyTwo(args[0]);
00283 
00284   } else if (name == plugin_method_identifiers[ID_IS_STORE_HEX]) {
00285     return StoreHex(args[0], args[1]);
00286 
00287   } else if (name == plugin_method_identifiers[ID_IS_APPEND_HEX]) {
00288     return AppendHex(args[0], args[1]);
00289   }
00290 
00291   return false;
00292 }

00337 // Bitmap painting -------------------------------------------------------------
00338 // Ugly gradient filled rectangle.
00339 void DrawSampleBitmap(NPDeviceContext2D* context, int width, int height) {
00340   printf("void DrawSampleBitmap(NPDeviceContext2D* context, int width, int height) {\n");
00341   int stride = context->stride;
00342   unsigned char* buffer = reinterpret_cast<unsigned char*>(context->region);
00343   static const int kPixelStride = 4;
00344 
00345   if (0 == height || 0 == width)
00346     return;
00347 
00348   static const float kVStep = 1.0 / static_cast<float>(height);
00349   static const float kHStep = 1.0 / static_cast<float>(width);
00350   static const float kAlphaStep = 1.0 / static_cast<float>(width + height);
00351   for (int i = 0; i < height; ++i) {
00352     for (int j = 0; j < width; ++j) {
00353       int index = i * stride + j * kPixelStride;
00354       float alpha = 1.0 - (i + j) * kAlphaStep;
00355       float red = i * kVStep;
00356       float green = j * kHStep;
00357       // BGRA, premultiplied alpha.
00358       buffer[index + 0] = 0x00;
00359       buffer[index + 1] = static_cast<unsigned char>(green * alpha * 255);
00360       buffer[index + 2] = static_cast<unsigned char>(red * alpha * 255);
00361       buffer[index + 3] = static_cast<unsigned char>(alpha * 255);
00362     }
00363   }
00364 }
00365 
00366 uint32_t HexStringToUInt(std::string hex_str) {
00367   printf("uint32_t HexStringToUInt(std::string hex_str) {\n");
00368   static const int hex_base = 16;
00369   uint64_t res = strtoul(hex_str.c_str(), NULL, hex_base);
00370 #if __LP64__
00371   // Long is 64-bits, we have to handle under/overflow ourselves.  Test to see
00372   // if the result can fit into 32-bits (as signed or unsigned).
00373   if (static_cast<int32_t>(static_cast<int64_t>(res)) !=
00374       static_cast<int64_t>(res) &&
00375       static_cast<uint32_t>(res) != res) {
00376     res = kuint32max;
00377   }
00378 #endif
00379   return static_cast<uint32_t>(res);
00380 }
00381 
00382 std::string Get2DImageChecksum(const NPDeviceContext2D* context) {
00383   printf("std::string Get2DImageChecksum(const NPDeviceContext2D* context) {\n");
00384   int row_count = context->dirty.bottom - context->dirty.top;
00385   int stride = context->dirty.right - context->dirty.left;
00386   static const int kPixelStride = 4;
00387   size_t length = row_count * stride * kPixelStride;
00388   MD5Digest md5_result;   // 128-bit digest
00389   MD5Sum(context->region, length, &md5_result);
00390   std::string hex_md5 = MD5DigestToBase16(md5_result);
00391   // Return the least significant 8 characters (i.e. 4 bytes)
00392   // of the 32 character hexadecimal result as an int.
00393   return hex_md5.substr(24);
00394 }

00398   printf("void FlushCallback(NPP instance, NPDeviceContext* context,\n");
00399 }

00401 NPExtensions* extensions = NULL;
00402 
00403 
00404 // Sine wave similar to one from simple_sources.cc
00405 // F is the desired frequency (e.g. 200), T is sample type (e.g. int16)
00406 template <int F, typename T> void SineWaveCallback(
00407     NPDeviceContextAudio *context) {
00408 
00409   const size_t n_samples  = context->config.sampleFrameCount;
00410   const size_t n_channels = context->config.outputChannelMap;
00411   const double th = 2 * 3.141592653589 * F / context->config.sampleRate;
00412   // store time value to avoid clicks on buffer boundries
00413   intptr_t t = (intptr_t)context->config.userData;
00414 
00415   T* buf = reinterpret_cast<T*>(context->outBuffer);
00416   for (size_t sample = 0; sample < n_samples; ++sample) {
00417     T value = static_cast<T>(sin(th * t++) * std::numeric_limits<T>::max());
00418     for (size_t channel = 0; channel < n_channels; ++channel) {
00419       *buf++ = value;
00420     }
00421   }
00422   context->config.userData = reinterpret_cast<void *>(t);
00423 }

00432 PluginObject::PluginObject(NPP npp)
00433     : npp_(npp),
00434       test_object_(browser->createobject(npp, GetTestClass())),
00435       device2d_(NULL),
00436       device3d_(NULL),
00437       pgl_context_(NULL),
00438       deviceaudio_(NULL) {
00439   memset(&context_audio_, 0, sizeof(context_audio_));
00440 }

00464 void PluginObject::New(NPMIMEType pluginType,
00465                        int16_t argc,
00466                        char* argn[],
00467                        char* argv[]) {
00468   printf("void PluginObject::New(NPMIMEType pluginType,\n");
00469   // Default to 2D rendering.
00470   dimensions_ = 2;
00471 
00472   for (int i = 0; i < argc; ++i) {
00473     if (strcmp(argn[i], "dimensions") == 0)
00474       dimensions_ = atoi(argv[i]);
00475   }
00476 
00477   if (!extensions) {
00478     browser->getvalue(npp_, NPNVPepperExtensions,
00479                       reinterpret_cast<void*>(&extensions));
00480     // CHECK(extensions);
00481   }
00482   device2d_ = extensions->acquireDevice(npp_, NPPepper2DDevice);
00483   if (device2d_ == NULL) {
00484     printf("Failed to acquire 2DDevice\n");
00485     exit(1);
00486   }
00487   //GAME.RegisterDevice2D(device2d_);
00488 
00489   device3d_ = extensions->acquireDevice(npp_, NPPepper3DDevice);
00490   if (device3d_ == NULL) {
00491     printf("Failed to acquire 3DDevice\n");
00492     exit(1);
00493   }
00494 
00495   deviceaudio_ = extensions->acquireDevice(npp_, NPPepperAudioDevice);
00496   if (deviceaudio_ == NULL) {
00497     printf("Failed to acquire AudioDevice\n");
00498     exit(1);
00499   }
00500 }

00503   printf("NPDeviceContext2D* PluginObject::GetContext2d(){\n");
00504   return context2d_;

00506 
00507 void PluginObject::SetWindow(const NPWindow& window) {
00508   printf("void PluginObject::SetWindow(const NPWindow& window) {\n");
00509   width_ = window.width;
00510   height_ = window.height;
00511 
00512   if (dimensions_ == 2) {
00513     NPDeviceContext2DConfig config;
00514     NPDeviceContext2D context;
00515     NPError err = device2d_->initializeContext(npp_, &config, &context);
00516     if (err != NPERR_NO_ERROR) {
00517       printf("Failed to initialize 2D context\n");
00518       exit(1);
00519     }
00520 
00521     context2d_ = &context;
00522     
00523     DrawSampleBitmap(&context, window.width, window.height);    
00524     plugin2d_checksum_ = HexStringToUInt(Get2DImageChecksum(&context));
00525     err = device2d_->getStateContext(npp_, &context,
00526                                      NPExtensionsReservedStateSharedMemoryChecksum,
00527                                      reinterpret_cast<intptr_t*>(&device2d_checksum_));
00528     if (err != NPERR_NO_ERROR) {
00529       printf("Failed to retrieve the 2D context checksum\n");
00530       exit(1);
00531     }
00532 
00533     // TODO(brettw) figure out why this cast is necessary, the functions seem
00534     // to match. Could be a calling convention mismatch?
00535     //NPDeviceFlushContextCallbackPtr callback =
00536     //reinterpret_cast<NPDeviceFlushContextCallbackPtr>(&FlushCallback);
00537     //device2d_->flushContext(npp_, &context, callback, NULL);
00538     device2d_->flushContext(npp_, &context, NULL, NULL);    
00539   }
00540   
00541   // Audio is only produced on the 2d version, because we embed two in the page.
00542   if (dimensions_ == 2 && !context_audio_.config.callback) {
00543     NPDeviceContextAudioConfig cfg;
00544     cfg.sampleRate       = 44100;
00545     cfg.sampleType       = NPAudioSampleTypeInt16;
00546     cfg.outputChannelMap = NPAudioChannelStereo;
00547     cfg.inputChannelMap  = NPAudioChannelNone;
00548     cfg.sampleFrameCount = 1024;
00549     cfg.startThread      = 1;  // Start a thread for the audio producer.
00550     cfg.flags            = 0;
00551     cfg.callback         = 0; //&SineWaveCallback<200, int16_t>; 
00552     NPError err = deviceaudio_->initializeContext(npp_, &cfg, &context_audio_);
00553 
00554 
00555     if (err != NPERR_NO_ERROR) {
00556       printf("Failed to initialize audio context\n");
00557       exit(1);
00558     }
00559   }
00560   //GAME
00561   
00562 }

00564 NPDevice* PluginObject::GetDevice2D(){
00565   printf("NPDevice* PluginObject::GetDevice2D(){\n");
00566   return device2d_;

00568 
00569 bool PluginObject::IsChecksumCheckSuccess() {
00570   printf("bool PluginObject::IsChecksumCheckSuccess() {\n");
00571   if (device2d_checksum_ != plugin2d_checksum_)
00572     return false;
00573   return true;
00574 }
00575 
00576 std::string PluginObject::ReportChecksum() {
00577   printf("std::string PluginObject::ReportChecksum() {\n");
00578   std::ostringstream output;
00579   if (device2d_checksum_ == plugin2d_checksum_) {
00580     output << "Checksums matched\n";
00581   } else {
00582     output << "ERROR: Failed to match device and plugin checksums\n";
00583   }
00584   output << "Device checksum:" << device2d_checksum_ << "\n";
00585   output << "Plugin checksum:" << plugin2d_checksum_ << "\n";
00586   return output.str();
00587 }
